basics.name: Doug Worsham
basics.label: Higher Education Leader, Learner, and Designer

work.name: UC San Diego Library
work.summary: Continually improve the holistic user experience across the Library's digital platforms.
highlights: Build organizational capacity and infrastructure for inclusive, accessible, and equitable design.
Center diverse voices at every stage of an engaged and evolving design process.
Direct and organize agile project teams to provide a bridge between user needs and highly technical groups, partners, and vendors.
Supervise and lead the Digital Experience Team, including 4 full-time staff and 7 student employee design assistants.

work.name: UCLA Library
highlights: Envisioned and implemented a scalable and sustainable online information literacy program leading to 9,300+ workshop completions and 376K+ YouTube tutorial views.
Co-authored the UCLA Library Strategic Plan for Teaching and Learning and UCLA’s Core Competencies for Research and Information Literacy.
Redesigned user-centered library spaces and services.
Built community and developed partnerships across campus, breaking down organizational barriers and fostering new library programs and services.
Taught UCLA credit courses on research, writing, and learner-led design.

work.name: University of Wisconsin - Madison. L&S Learning Support Services
work.position: Sr. Instructional Consulting Coordinator and AV Services Coordinator
highlights: Partnered extensively with faculty, staff, and students in the design and development of digital services and technology enhanced teaching and learning tools.
Designed, developed, and scaled Collaborative Sites, an online learning platform serving 40 classes and 1300+ students
Managed the AV Pool, 40 media classrooms and 5 computer labs. Supervised 20 student employees.
Produced and edited instructional media and podcasts.
Co-authored 3 Campus-wide Strategic Plan Charters. Chaired the Community of Education Technology Support Steering Committee.

work.name: University of Wisconsin - Madison. Program in English as a Second Language
highlights: Taught classes in academic oral skills for graduate students and in the University’s intensive English program.
Created original listening texts by recording and editing audio interviews with community members and students.
